title: A production imagining the assassination of Katie Hopkins is taking to the stage later this month
text:

A new theatre production which imagines the death of Katie Hopkins is taking to the stage later this month. 
Provocatively titled ‘The Assassination of Katie Hopkins’, the musical is using the Devon columnist’s fictional death as a way to explore wider issues of “truth, celebrity and public outrage”. Read More Katie Hopkins and Exeter MP Ben Bradshaw in Twitter spat over Brexit marches 
Co-writer of the show, Chris Bush, hopes that the production will challenge people’s preconceptions about her. 
In an interview with The Guardian , he said: “She is someone who generates very, very strong opinions, positively or negatively, and what interests me as a writer is challenging assumptions.” Playwright Chris Bush is keen to use the play to challenge people's assumptions and explore reaction to reports of a high-profile death 
He added: “I disagree with the vast majority of what Katie Hopkins has to say. 
“Politically I couldn’t be much further from where she is on a spectrum. 
“Whether she is useful or has any right to say what she says is a much more complicated question." 
The production, Mr Bush hopes, will examine social media, the mob mentality and the limits of free speech. Devon's Ben Bradshaw and Katie Hopkins recently clashed over Brexit marches in Exeter (Image: Bridget Batchelor) 
“I think it is very easy to think there isn’t any real world impact to writing something online or sharing something,” Mr Bush said. 
“Does having the right to a voice give you a right to a platform?” 
Mr Bush hopes that that the production will help to raise difficult questions such as these as opposed to laying out a manifesto, while also exploring people's reactions to reports of a high-profile death. Read More
